second stage has 4 nozzles, third stage has one nozzle and 4 vernier nozzels at the side.

Edit: Also I'm removing Model{} config, instead moving to compressed textures, it will remove some major headaches I was having with the fuel tanks (lack of AO).

Beale, I think it would be better if you make two or three types of nozzles and a few bases to them. Then, with simple manipulations with part.cfg you can make bunch of different engines (i.e. RD-191, RD-180 and RD-170/171 uses same chambers/nozzles!). In addition, with procedural engine bases from PF...mmmm...

Beale, I think it would be better if you make two or three types of nozzles and a few bases to them. Then, with simple manipulations with part.cfg you can make bunch of different engines (i.e. RD-191, RD-180 and RD-170/171 uses same chambers/nozzles!). In addition, with procedural engine bases from PF...mmmm...

Intriguing concept, I'll look into how practical it would be!

Delicious Ambient Occlusion

Very very WIP

Edited September 17, 2014 by Beale
How do you make a texture 'stock-like'? I wonder because I've tried to do it but I just couldn't find a perspective on how to get even close to it with my parts.

How do you make a texture 'stock-like'? I wonder because I've tried to do it but I just couldn't find a perspective on how to get even close to it with my parts.

Any particular difficult points?

In general I use the smudge tool a lot, draw general lighter lines and smudge them in.

You just have to build up several layers of grime and scratches, and I think you approach the stock look a bit.

Also you can take parts from textures found on stock objects.

^ I guess you could wrap that around a fuel tank or something...

Also shadows add to it.

If you have a pipe or something on the model, add shadows beneath to "fake" ambient occlusion

I'm no expert at texturing techniquies, but let me know if you have further questions!

Edited September 17, 2014 by Beale

Yup, but to be honest everything I use in Photoshop can be found in GIMP or even Paint.NET with plugins Good luck!

Well, I think it'll be possible to make one of the Korolyev proposed variants, to launch 1 Proton with LOK and the other with Block D and LK.

As I remember, you were already making the Soyuz one. What happened to it?

I'm not really sure.

The Proton will I think be able to send the LOK/LK/BlockD complex trans-munar (Not sure actually). Not accurate, but it will be sufficient for now I think.

I guess it's no problem if the Proton gets a 'super' heavy lifter status in KSP but I think a Block D with the LOK is kinda unnecessary for a Munar mission. I mean the LOK already has a lot of DV and if the third stage can push it with the LK into a TMI it's enough and less complicated. Although however you decide, it can't be bad.
